Metformin is a drug for the treatment of diabetes in its early stages.  One of its side effects can be weight loss.  I have no idea whether it's safe or even effective for non-diabetics.  On the other hand, since you are overweight, you are at risk for diabetes.  It never hurts to ask your doctor for an A1C test, which gives you your average glucose reading for the last three months.Fasting blood sugar tests are inadequate for the diagnosis of diabetes, whatever your doctor says.  The A1C is the gold standard, and probably everybody over 50 or overweight should have one annually.  If you get a reading of 6.5 or higher, you will require treatment, and metformin is an excellent medication, often prescribed in conjunction with other drugs including insulin for some people.
